result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:23 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jalen E A Hayes in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Jalen E A Hayes. Atty. Schoenfeldt provides an update; he is still working with the ADA assigned to the case to resolve the matter.  Atty. Schoenfeldt requests a new plea and sentencing date in November.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by Atty Schoenfeldt requesting an adjournment of the plea/sentencing.  **Reviewed by Judge Lau - adjournment granted.**
Character letter
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
See minutes from the 05/25/2022 Hearing.

02:40 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jalen E A Hayes in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Peter M Wolff and Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Schoenfeldt advises he was just retained on this matter.  Based on that information the Court will grant Atty. Wolff's motion to withdraw as counsel, and he is excused.  Atty. Schoenfeldt provides an update, he is asking the matter be set for projected plea and sentencing.  Court notes there was a speedy trial demand and the matter is set for trial next month.  Atty. Schoenfeldt advises his client will be withdrawing the speedy trial demand.  Court confirms with the defendant he is withdrawing his speedy trial demand.  Court will cancel the jury status on 06/08/2022 and the jury trial on 06/21/2022.  Matter will be set for projected plea and sentencing in about 30-45 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Atty. Mark A Schoenfeldt.

Hearing on May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Filed by Atty. Wolff requesting a sooner court date to address his motion to withdraw as counsel and advising the defendant plans to withdraw his speedy trial demand.    ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 5/20/22 - Clerk's office to try to schedule for a sooner court date.**
Motion to Withdraw as counsel filed by Atty. Wolff.   ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 5/19/22 - Court to address at the next hearing on 06/08/2022.**

10:53 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Jalen E A Hayes in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes defense filed a bail motion.  Atty. Wolff presents arguments, he is asking that the cash bail amount be lowered.  State objects and presents arguments.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court denies the motion to modify bail; bail remains as fixed.  Court notes the matter is set for jury status on 6/8/22 at 8:30 with a  jury trial set to begin on 6/21/22 and will maintain those dates as previously set.
Court's response to defendant's inmate communication form filed on 5/3/22 re: bail reduction.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 4/29/22; requesting a bail reduction.    ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 5/3/22 - Defendant is represented by Counsel.  Defendant needs to contact his counsel to have a formal bail motion filed.** 
**Response letter sent to the defendant**
Bail/bond hearing on May 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Legal Notice! Name Declaration, Correction Proclamation, and Publication
Motion to Modify Bail

09:40 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing. Defendant Jalen E A Hayes in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Abigail Broze, for attorney Peter M Wolff.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is set to address defense's bail motion but the Court also needs to reschedule the jury status in June due to a trial set that week.  Attorney Lesli S Boese has now appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will first set a new jury status date with counsel.  Court will next address the bail motion.  Atty. Broze presents arguments and is asking the court to lower the cash bail amount.  State objects and presents arguments.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court denies the motion to modify bail; bail to remain as previously set.  Court will maintain the jury status and trial dates in June.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Letter filed by defendant's mom regarding bail reduction
  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 04-14-22.** No action to be taken by the court.
Bail/bond hearing on April 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Wolff.

Jury status hearing on June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Made in Court by Atty. Wolff at the 04/04/2022
Bail/bond hearing on April 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:25 AM; Case called for Bail/bond Hearing. Defendant Jalen E A Hayes in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a motion to modify bail was filed by defense.  Atty. Wolff presents arguments; he is asking for a lower amount of cash bail as well as Huber Bailee status.  State objects and presents statements.  Atty. Wolff presents additional statements.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court declines the motion to modify bail; bail to remain as previously set.  Atty. Wolff is asking for a Speedy trial, and it should take 2 days.  State agrees.  Court advises counsel that witness lists, proposed jury instructions and any motions in limine should be filed no later than 48 hours before the jury status date.  Court will adjourn for jury status and a 2 day jury trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bail
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
08:19 AM Defendant Jalen E A Hayes in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
DDA Boese states that the offer given to the Defendant contemplated waiving prelim; offer is now revoked. 
The Court conducts a hearing:

Trooper Alex Medina, of the Wisconsin State Patrol, sworn in and testifies on direct by DDA Boese.
Cross examination by attorney Wolff.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Attorney Wolff to file a bail motion by end of day.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:58 AM Defendant Jalen E A Hayes in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wolff requests an adjournment.    Preliminary time limits waived.    Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Attorney Peter Wolff
